intro: Centaurea petrocaula, commonly known as the rock centaurea, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its bright blue or purple flowers. This species typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in arid or semi-arid environments. The plant has slender stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. It is well adapted to survive in harsh conditions, making it a resilient and hardy species.
